TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlProcessingInstruction extends System.Xml.XmlLinkedNode

Docs.summary: Represents a processing instruction, which XML defines to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document.

Docs.param: The target of the processing instruction; see the property.
The content of the instruction; see the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Do not instantiate an <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction> directly; instead, use methods such as <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode (bool deep);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode(bool deep) cil managed
Public Overrides Function CloneNode (deep As Boolean) As XmlNode
public: override System::Xml::XmlNode ^ CloneNode(bool deep);
override this.CloneNode : bool -> System.Xml.XmlNode

Docs.param: to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; to clone only the node itself.
Docs.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `CloneNode` serves as a copy constructor for nodes. For processing instruction nodes, the cloned node always includes the target and data. To see how this method behaves with other node types, see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A> method in the `XmlNode` class.
The cloned node has no parent (<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`).

Docs.param: The to which you want to save.
Docs.summary: Saves all the children of the node to the specified . Because ProcessingInstruction nodes do not have children, this method has no effect.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
